group_1.textCenter: (The Yukuni Board of Education looks to be@around this area...)
(Even when approaching the topic of Magical Girls@as a third party,
I never imagined that our conversation at the@Festival would be useful in this way.)
I might as well give this a try.
("Head of the Office of Educational Planning"?@Hard to gauge how much influence it has...)

group_1.textRight: So, you are familiar with the rumors circulating@among the students here, then?

group_1.textLeft: Indeed.
That whole story about Magical Girls has become@a hot topic among students.
We're aware of that.

group_1.textRight: Actually, my area of expertise lies in studying@such Magical Girls.

group_1.textLeft: Haha, surely you must be joking.@It's just a rumor amidst students, you know?

group_1.textRight: When you say it like that, it does sting a bit...
Consider the traditional performing arts of the@Yukuni Hot Springs Village, for instance.
Local folk beliefs in fairy tales and yōkai legends@are widespread.
These aspects also play a significant role in the@study of folklore.

group_1.textLeft: I see...
Now that you put it that way, it's true that@fantasies are not to be dismissed.

group_1.textRight: That's right, legends and customs can be seen to@represent the very essence of the land.
Naturally, the same applies to Magical Girls.
What's intriguing, though, is that unlike the others,
Magical Girls are a worldwide phenomenon.
So I'd like to make a proposal.@May I be allowed to give a lecture?

group_1.textLeft: Regarding Magical Girls?

group_1.textRight: Yes.
Just as Tono is famous for its folklore,
Yukuni City too will become renowned as a center@of folklore studies.

group_1.textLeft: I find all this particularly intriguing since I'm not@very familiar with it.
But without any supporting materials, there's no@way for us to adequately address it in a lecture.

group_1.textRight: I will, of course, prepare the necessary materials@needed for the presentation.

group_1.textLeft: I understand.
Still, thank you for delving into the rumors of a@small town like this.

group_1.textRight: If the bullying is left to fester unattended like@this, it could lead to irreversible consequences.

group_1.textLeft: ...Bullying?

group_1.textRight: To be honest, it seems that some girls are@being bullied
because of the false image of Magical Girls that@is being passed around among students...
Personally, I would like to address that issue@first and foremost.

group_1.textLeft: I haven't heard anything about this...

group_1.textRight: By the time news of this reaches your ear,@it might be too late...

group_1.textLeft: About the lecture, are those children involved?

group_1.textRight: Yes.

group_1.textLeft: We must first assess the situation before acting,@or there's a risk of exacerbating the danger.
Could you wait while we gather information?

group_1.textRight: How long will that take?

group_1.textLeft: Well, I'm going to consult with other departments@to determine how to proceed, so it's hard to say.

group_1.textRight: No, it's too late for that now.

group_1.textLeft: So long as we receive no reports from the various@schools, there is no bullying in this town.
If you want to claim that it "exists", then we'll@need to investigate first.

group_1.textRight: Now's not the time to take it easy...!

group_1.textLeft: I’m afraid it's not safe for us to discuss the@Magical Girl rumor at this time, sir.

group_1.textRight: Please wait a minute!

group_1.textLeft: Given some time, we'll find out if there's any@bullying occurring.

group_1.textRight: Tch...
